By  Northern Star StaffFebruary  

View Campus Blotter  in a larger map

The following was taken directly from the University Police PERIOD Anyone mentioned is presumed innocent until proved guilty in a court of law PERIOD The University Police Department provides police reports on the Web at finfacil.niu.eduPublicSafety PERIOD

Friday

On Nov PERIOD  at  a.m. an officer was dispatched to New Hall East in regard to a report of theft PERIOD The officer met with the complainant and took a report PERIOD On Friday the case was administratively closed due to a lack of leads PERIOD

On Jan PERIOD  at  p.m. an officer was dispatched to the NIU Police Department to take a report in regard to theft PERIOD The officer took a report PERIOD On Friday the complainant recovered their property PERIOD This case is closed PERIOD

At  a.m. an officer was dispatched to the  block of Normal Road in regard to a report of an injured individual PERIOD The officer arrived on scene and located the complainant PERIOD The officer determined that the complainant falsely reported the incident PERIOD The complainant was referred to the Office of Community Standards and Student Conduct for disorderly conduct PERIOD

At  p.m. an officer was dispatched to Neptune East in regard to a report of cannabis PERIOD The officer made contact with an individual in the room in question PERIOD Contact resulted in the individual being referred to the Office of Community Standards and Student Conduct for possession of a controlled substance PERIOD

At  p.m. an officer was dispatched to Neptune North in regard to a report of theft PERIOD The officer met with the complainant and took a report PERIOD This case is open pending further investigation PERIOD

Saturday

At  a.m. an officer on patrol of Grant Towers North made contact with an individual who was under  and intoxicated PERIOD Contact resulted in the individual being referred to the Office of Community Standards and Student Conduct for unlawful consumption of alcohol by a minor PERIOD

At  a.m. an officer on patrol of New Hall West made contact with an individual who was under  and intoxicated PERIOD Contact resulted in the individual being referred to the Office of Community Standards and Student Conduct for unlawful consumption of alcohol by a minor PERIOD

At  a.m. an officer on patrol of Stevenson Towers North made contact with an individual who was under  and in possession of alcohol PERIOD Contact resulted in the individual being referred to the Office of Community Standards and Student Conduct for unlawful possession of alcohol by a minor PERIOD

At  p.m. an officer was dispatched to the Recreation Center in regard to a report of theft PERIOD The officer met with the complainant and took a report PERIOD This case is open pending further investigation PERIOD
